headline: Trump Refilling Strategic Petroleum Reserve – Big Oil Could Benefit
summary: The U.S. Strategic Petroleum Reserve (SPR) was created in 1975 by the Energy Policy and Conservation Act, signed into law by President Gerald Ford. It was established in response to the 1973-1974 oil embargo, which highlighted the U.S. economy’s vulnerability to oil supply disruptions. Those who were around at the time, like your author, witnessed ... Trump Refilling Strategic Petroleum Reserve – Big Oil Could Benefit

headline: Microsoft, Meta Set To Report Earnings As Investors Watch Out For Trump-Xi, Fed Meeting
summary: This week will witness earnings releases from the Magnificent 7 stocks. Investors will await news from Trump-Xi meeting. Read here for more details.

headline: Chevron (CVX): Evaluating Valuation After Karachaganak Production Cut Linked to Geopolitical Tensions
summary: Chevron, one of the world’s largest energy companies, has cut production at the Karachaganak field after a Ukrainian drone strike damaged a nearby gas processing plant in Russia. This move highlights how quickly geopolitical risks can ripple through global oil operations and affect supply stability. See our latest analysis for Chevron. The recent production cut at Karachaganak comes not long after Chevron completed its $53 billion all-stock acquisition of Hess Corp., and just ahead of the...
